alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:15AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Blaine and Hill Counties. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:25 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:25 AM MDT Tuesday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to slowly fall this week. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM MDT.
